mdRecord.dcterms:title: P.D. Hoyt House, exterior|general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
Wright, Frank Lloyd (American architect, 1867-1959) [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Designed for the Hoyt's in 1906 and typical of the Prairie style, this Wright design features a two story, square floor plan with a central broad chimney, a low-pitched hip roof with broad, overhanging eaves and a matching hip roof above the entry which was replaced with a Japanese-influenced trellis in the 1980s, due to the addition of a tall privacy wall in front of the house. Built by brothers August and Oscar Wilson. The Wilson brothers built many homes and buildings in the Geneva historic district and studied under Wright. On August 4, 2012 the house suffered damage from a fire, it is currently being repaired. -- http://www.franklloydwrightsites.com/illinois/geneva/hoyt.htm [work]
